comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: It's a good idea, but hope should be kept alive that things will get better despite the unforseen circumstances. I have a little advice, which is to try to help if you see someone in need. One person may not be able to cause a change, but they can make a difference. Even if you teach people about crypto, some will need money to invest, and crypto is not a get-rich-quick scheme. While some people require a consistent income, crypto may not be able to meet their needs in the early stages of teaching it, but some will still appreciate the knowledge and can excel in it.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: These days, na who need help them they help o. It is like throwing gold to a swine. A swine knows not what gold is, nor its value in the market. Where people complain is a place where people have almost given up hope. In as much as we want to help, we must first understand why they complain. If it is because of less money or means to earn, by all means enlighten the person on crypto and even offer to mentor them for the time being. Surely if they see the results you get and how legit the procedures are, you would have definitely helped and it would be left for them to decide.
